title: Hardware Seed fundraising metrics benchmarks
summary: Seed-stage hardware metrics focus on manufacturing readiness, cost trajectory, and customer validation. Unlike software, hardware companies are measured on physical product development milestones. These benchmarks help investors assess your progress toward production viability. Pitchchat keeps fundraising metrics investor-ready in one room.

metrics.label: Bill of Materials Cost
metrics.note: Prototype BOM is higher than production but should show clear path to target. Component-level cost reduction plan should be documented.

metrics.label: First Pass Yield
metrics.note: Early production FPY showing improvement trend. Root cause analysis on failures with clear remediation plan.

metrics.label: Prototype Generation
metrics.note: Multiple iterations showing design convergence. Each generation should address issues from previous with declining ECO rate.

metrics.label: Field Units Deployed
metrics.note: Enough deployment to validate real-world performance. Runtime hours and environment diversity matter.

metrics.label: Customer Commitments
metrics.note: Pre-orders, LOIs, or pilot commitments showing willingness to pay. Quality of commitment (binding vs. soft) matters.

metrics.label: Gross Margin Target
metrics.note: Target gross margin at production volume. Current margin may be negative but path should be clear.

metrics.label: Development Team Size
metrics.note: Core team with mechanical, electrical, and firmware capability. Manufacturing engineering expertise is valuable.

metrics.label: Capital Raised
metrics.note: Hardware seed rounds tend larger than software given capital intensity. Includes non-dilutive (grants, crowdfunding).

metrics.label: Certification Status
metrics.note: Clear understanding of required certifications (UL, FCC, CE) with timeline and budget.

metrics.label: Time to Production
metrics.note: Realistic timeline from current state to production shipments. Include certification and manufacturing ramp.
